channel.title: Standing on the shoulders of giants

item.title: Python tips
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description:
Ignore escaping characters such as "\"

>>> print r""" This is '\myfolder\'"""
>>>  This is '\myfolder\'

item.title: Put an emoji icon in your Github commit message
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description:
Example:

git commit -m 'Fixed whatever, time for :beers:'

See list of emoji here: http://scotch.io/bar-talk/emoji-icons-in-github-commit-messages

item.title: Port in use
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description:
To find which application is using a specific port, do:

lsof -i <port-number>

Or list ports with associated processes in use:

netstat -putln

item.title: Logs
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description:
The configuration and especially right permissions will be done in /etc/rsyslog.conf

Bitmask is going to be used so use this doc http://www.cyberciti.biz/faq/unix-linux-bsd-chmod-numeric-permissions-notation-command/

It will be taken into account for the new log files only when we reload rsylog with this commend:

/etc/init.d/rsyslog reload

The old files are still on the old configuration. So, you need to change the right access directly for them with chown and chmod.

Example for vagrant user:

root@openerp-development:/var/log/openerp# chown vagrant:vagrant /var/log/openerp/ -R
root@openerp-development:/var/log/openerp# chmod a+r /var/log/openerp/ -R

Source: http://www.rsyslog.com/

item.title: Screen monitoring
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description:
You can use this chrome plugin if you want to monitor different screen with a slideshow: https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/tabcarousel/ddldimidiliclngjipajmjjiakhbcohn?hl=en

For instance, if you want to have a view on your Kanban and on the state of the continuous integration for monitoring if the tests are passing.

item.title: Execute sql from file
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description: psql yourdatabase -f path_of_your_file.sql

item.title: Agile testing
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description:
The best book I ever read about testing and best practices in an Agile project is: Agile Testing: A Practical Guide for Testers and Agile Teams (Addison-Wesley Signature)

The main idea of Agility is constantly giving and receiving feedback in order to keep improving the process and the output of the project.

item.title: Copy records from postgresql to csv file
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description:
COPY(QUERY) TO 'FILENAME' WITH CSV HEADER;

For the other way around see: Copy records from csv file to postgres DB

item.title: Using enum in python
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description:
pip install enum34

Example:

from enum import Enum
Animal = enum('Animal', 'ant bee cat dog')

or equivalently:

class Animals(Enum):
    ant = 1
    bee = 2
    cat = 3
    dog = 4

Source: http://stackoverflow.com/questions/36932/how-can-i-represent-an-enum-in-python

https://docs.python.org/3/library/enum.html

item.title: Tipue search
item.dc:creator: Matthieu Choplin
item.description:
As the number of posts is growing, I think that having a search engine within the website is now relevant. This post only shows what I am using for that.

Instead of using an external search engine such as Google or DuckDuckGo, you have a plugin in Nikola than enables searching on the client side by using jQuery.

Assuming you have installed Nikola > v7.0, you can install the plugin like this:

nikola plugin -i localsearch

It will give you a configuration sample to paste in your config.py file.

Source: http://plugins.getnikola.com/#localsearch
